subject: Art
title: Digital Painting Process
description: A step-by-step workflow from blank canvas to finished painting.

hook.text: Staring at a blank white canvas is intimidating. Having a process turns that blank canvas into a series of manageable steps. Here's a professional digital painting workflow.

buildup.text: The process: (1) Thumbnail sketches. (2) Rough sketch. (3) Value study. (4) Refined sketch. (5) Base colors. (6) Lighting/shadow pass. (7) Detail rendering. (8) Polish and effects. (9) Final adjustments.

discovery.text: Work big to small: establish the overall composition first (thumbnails), then large shapes (rough sketch), then values (value study), then medium details, and finally fine details. Never start with details.

twist.text: Most time should be spent on steps 1-5. Steps 6-9 go faster when the foundation is solid. Rushing to rendering on a weak foundation means reworking â€” which takes MORE time, not less.

quiz.question: Why should most time be spent on early stages (thumbnails, sketch, values)?
options: A solid foundation makes rendering faster; a weak foundation requires costly rework
